page.title: 18THE BRUSHMAKERS' ARMS,UPHAM
page.content: The Brushmakers' Arms is a quaint and picturesque building about 450 years old. Long ago it was used as a meeting place for the brush makers of Hampshire, but it was and is still a Public House as well. In fact it was one of the twelve most haunted pubs in the country. During the 16th. Century a miserly old brushmaker called Chicket was robbed and murdered whilst lodging at this Inn. His ghost was said to have been heard counting coins and pacing the room above the Bar. The murder of Chicket happened on the same day as the Tudor warship the "Mary Rose" sank in Portsmouth Harbour and it is rumoured that his murderer was aboard the ship. Since the raising of the "Mary Rose" no further footsteps or chinking coins have been heard.
